dinosaurs1.bio: Tyrannosaurus (meaning tyrant lizard) is a genus of coelurosaurian theropod dinosaur.
Velociraptor (meaning swift seizer in Latin) is a genus of dromaeosaurid theropod dinosaur that lived approximately 75 to 71 million years ago during the later part of the Cretaceous Period.

Triceratops is a genus of herbivorous ceratopsid dinosaur that first appeared during the late Maastrichtian stage of the late Cretaceous period, about 68 million years ago in what is now North America.
